question: 頻りに
sourceMnemonic: Something that goes towards being <kanji>frequent</kanji> is something that is <vocabulary>frequently</vocabulary> happening.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: Something that happens <vocabulary>frequently</vocabulary> is something that has really caught on. People want to do this thing frequently, because it is so <reading>chic</reading> (<ja>しき</ja>).
